channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was dropped by a package handler & the package had leaked & was brought to qa for inspection DescribePack: loose cap because the package was dropped by a package handler while being unloaded off a van DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: was placed in a hazmat tote & was brought to the Qa cage for processing

item.title: Report X-2023101398
item.description:
Report X-2023101398

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being loaded and package handler felt that out fiberboard box was damp. Alerted QA and they inspected package, found that closure was loose & leaking. Taken to HaZMat cage for reports and further inspection. Placed in red salvage tub. DescribePack: Spray bottle with hose for pouring began to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in plastic lined, red salvage tub. DPR entered, ISP report done, and Hess incident report being entered.

item.title: Report X-2023101389

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking upon inspection of inner contents 4 x 1 gallon plastic bottles of decon labs denature ethanol 190 proof 1 bottle had a loose cap allowing .25 gallon to release from bottle package had no slotted partitions, bags or absorbent facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: 1 x 1 gallon bottle of decon labs denatured ethanol 190 proof had a loose cap allowing .25 gallon to release DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

item.title: Report X-2023101348

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: LEWISBERRY

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking upon inspection of inner contents 4 x 4 liter plastic bottles of color wright wright stain three 4 liter plastic bottles were cracked and leaking along the seams of the bottles allowing 1 liter from each plastic bottle to release package did have a cardboard liner on top with slotted partitions no bags or absorbent was found facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: Three 4 liter plastic bottles were cracked and leaking along the seams of the bottles allowing 1 liter from each bottle to release DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

Upon inspection it was discovered that all 4 x 1 gallon cans of Isopropanol had loose caps causing them all to leak. due to them leaking, they damaged all 4 x 1 gallon cans. DescribePack: 4 x 1 gallon cans of isopropanol had a loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in a designated red hazardous materials bin

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED ON THE IR1 IRREG BELT, THE RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO THE PACKAGE SINCE THE PACKAGE WAS WET. THE RESPONDER INSPECTED THE PACKAGE AND FOUND THAT PART WAS LEAKING. THE RESPONDER TRANSPORTED THE PACKAGE TO THE DMP AND SEALED THE LEAK. THE RESPONDER THEN STARTED THE PROCESS THROUGH THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

NO LIQUID ON FLOOR NO NEED FOR ZEP ZORBENT. RESPONDER PLACED THE BOX IN A GREEN PLASTIC DMP BAG AND REMOVED IT TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023101061
item.description:
Report X-2023101061

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-13
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton ripped torn wet and leaking package found in trailer #451702 already damaged ripped torn wet and leaking. upon inspection of inner contents 4 x 1 gallon plastic bottles of automatic warewashing detergent 2 1 gallon plastic bottles had loose caps causing leakage and allowing .25 gallons to release. no slotted partitions bags or absorbent was found. facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. package handler Thomas coulson was injured while attempting to pick up the box not knowing or seeing that the box was wet and leaking the liquid only got onto his hands he was attended to right away DescribePack: 2 out of 4 1 gallon plastic bottles had loose caps allowing .25 gallons to release DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat lined tote

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During inbound sort this hazmat was observed to have a small amount of liquid pooled under the pails bottom. QA notified immediately. Proper hazmat PPE was employed (gloves/safety glasses/outer shell jacket). The pail was placed inside a hazmat plastic bag and transferred to our hazmat cage. DescribePack: spill DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: spill

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Undeclared / unprocessed HazMat appears to have leaked, when noticed it was brought to QA. No actual spillage but top of carton shows signs of leakage. DescribePack: Top closure. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to HazMat cage, no spillage just signs that small minimal amount leaked and was captured and absorbed in Fiberboard Box.

item.title: Report X-2023101261
item.description:
Report X-2023101261

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-17T18:14:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-09
  • City: ZELIENOPLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Damaged package brought to QA-3 for inspection. Upon inspection, the damaged package was an undeclared hazmat. The damage amounted in .5x1 Gallon of leakage. A SDS was obtained for the contents. Hazmat paperwork and proper procedure were followed. The leaking undeclared hazmat was placed in a hazmat bag and red hazmat bin and placed in the hazmat cage. DescribePack: There was a loose cap and leakage in the amount of .5x1 Gallon DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The leaking undeclared hazmat was placed in a hazmat bag and red hazmat bin and placed in the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023101257
item.description:
Report X-2023101257

  • City: BREINIGSVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA received a yellow savage drum from the SECA trailer. Upon inspection QA noticed it was RTS for being an improper hazmat. There was no further paperwork recargarding an RTS, so QA opened the lid to inspect. QA found 4 bottles of Calci-Solve Super Strength Descaler in a 1 inch pool of its liquid without its original box. QA resealed the lid and put drum in Hazmat cage DescribePack: All bottles appeared to have slight leakage DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Yellow drum was resealed and placed in cage

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found the damaged hazmat in a red hazardous waste bin on the hazmat pallet in QA. There is a big wet spot on the box DescribePack: There is no visible damage to the bottle but there were a couple of liquid droplets around the cap of one bottle. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The bottles were kept upright, and the caps were tightened to prevent more leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023101024
item.description:
Report X-2023101024

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-11
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found the damaged package in damages and saw the corrosive dot on the package as well. There was no OP-900 or a HAZ on the shipping label. It did leak out a bit, the wet spot is on the body of the box near the top. I do see wet spots around the caps on the bottles. DescribePack: I turned the bottles upside down to see where the leak was coming from but couldn't identify where the cause of the leak was. The bottles were wet on the outside of it. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Kept it upright to prevent any more leaks

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: This Hazmat was discovered to be leaking during the unload process. The package fell on its side and the methanol leaked out from the lid. There was no plastic or tape on the cap to keep it closed. There was also no seal. DescribePack: The cap became loose and the methanol leaked out through the cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was put into a Hazmat bin, lined with a plastic bag.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: I was informed there was a damaged hazmat in a drum in the hazmat cage that need to be processed. The OP-900 was placed on the drum for me to identify what's in the drum. I put on proper PPE to inspect the package by the vent hood table and to see where the damage was. DescribePack: The bottom of the glass bottle is severally cracked. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was placed in a sealed drum and moved into the hazmat cage.

DescribePack: Too much weight on package, 5-gallon jerrican DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: to mitigate the release, I used the spill neutralizer.
